Description: Shoulder sherd of Aeolian black Polychrome pottery closed vessel, probably an oinochoe; fine orange clay with much gold mica; exterior, from top: frieze of incised tongues alternately added white, black, and added red; traces of wide band in added white and narrow band in added red. Sharp carination preserved on inside at lower break.
Curator's comments: The fabric and decoration are very similar to 1888,0601.573b-c, though the added colour bands seem different. NAA analysis carried out on those sherds shows that they come from Aeolis.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.256, no.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.50)
